website_summaries.verdict: This nail gun reduces work time by perfectly driving nails with each trigger pull while shortening your overall workload.
pros: Able to drive 60 nails per minute
Easy to adjust air pressure and depth-of-drive without tools
Lasts a long time on a single charge
cons: Rechargeable battery and charger sold separately

customer_reviews.title: I needed a Trim Nailer, for a special project ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Trim Nailer, for a special project, where I couldn't get my air compressor. I was really surprised with the quality and features of this unit. I needed to nail 1 1/2" brads through Oak - every nail went in solid and no issues or bent/jammed brads. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Lee R Bernardo

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to using this for a current remodel project and I am very impressed! It works great and you adjust the air pressure and the nail feeder actuator to help with under and over-driving. It consistently fired without any further adjustment as I used the tool. To be free of an air compressor for this type of tool is a wonderful thing-- especially when you are laying a floor, installing trim, or faux beams. I plan to buy the other air guns from Ryobi to replace other compressor-dependent guns. Thanks, Ryobi for inventing this!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great! Use GRIP RITE nails! Oil the feed and punch!
customer_reviews.text: It works like a dream! Be sure to buy GRIP RITE 18 gauge nails they don’t jam! Be sure to oil the feed and the punch! Real easy to clear out jams from inferior nails (Hitachi). My only complaint is that it is a little hefty but I used it for six hours today assembling bee hives!
customer_reviews.author: John J.

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality tool
customer_reviews.text: My second one. One of my crew borrowed my old one and liked it so much he asked to keep it . I am a pro and it gets heavy use and stands up. Thousands of nails and only one minor overhaul. Just purchased the 16 ga version.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Zappala

customer_reviews.title: it will misfire occasionally but just keep the nail channel oiled "lightly" perfect.
customer_reviews.text: i replaced my compressor, hose, and nailer with this and never looked back, it will misfire occasionally but just keep the nail channel oiled "lightly" perfect.
customer_reviews.author: paggeau

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and easy nailer
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Very easy to use - no need for an air compressor. Just load in the brads, pop the battery in, and go. Made my project very quick and easy. The light was an added bonus. I didn't think that would be a big deal one way or another, but it's actually very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: rkp1

customer_reviews.title: cheaper than a compressor and nail gun, way more portable
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome brad nailer. I completed a whole tree house siding that I set up on a single charge on the battery, and all of the nails went in completely. Honestly, this is a really good option to purchase if you already have a few of the Ryobi batteries or other tools. I don't know too much on the durability, but I don't use this professionally. It is a great value to have around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for small projects
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble using it at first but after reading the manual and watching a video I was fine. I bought the refurbished version because of the significant price difference ($70). I hope it lasts a long time. But I like the features like the led lights, and the lights flash when there is a jam or nailer needs attention.. I would recommend buying the bigger battery for this nailer. All I have is 2 smaller ones and they dont seem to last. Overall, great price and great product! UPDATE**** THE NAILER NOW SHOOTS EVERY OTHER TIME. NOT SURE IF ITS THE NAILER OR THE TYPE OF nailes but its very annoying
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excels my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I will start this review in saying "oh yeah" this is a tool I've been having way too much fun with! With a 9 amp hour battery, it is very heavy. However lighter than my pnumatic Bradley guns. That being said, on jobs without electricity, this thing can finish an entire house without breaking a sweat. I have had zero issue with it penetrating every single wood or material. On a side note I probably should not own this tool.... with the power cranked up and the depth set as low as possible I now have a nail launcher and have been causing chaos. Haha. Everyone should own one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Truck Guy

customer_reviews.title: Buy it even if you don't need it. It shoots nails.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't do staples, but it did keep me from buying a compressor! It came with 2" brads, and it drives 3" 18ga below the surface easy. I haven't depleted a whole charge yet, I think the battery will last for a house worth of door and baseboard. If you have Ryobi One+, then get this.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Lindo (or her hubby)

customer_reviews.title: Battery Nailer
customer_reviews.text: After a month of constant use I can confidently say that this is a great nail gun. It is so much easier than dragging an air hose around behind me and easier than lugging around an air compressor. Battery seems to last a log time on it if you put one on with a full charge. My only complaint is that it acts empty with the last three nails in there. Maybe it's a type of safety feature, but annoying none the less. Everything else has been exactly what I wanted though.
customer_reviews.author: gladatlast

customer_reviews.title: Really good but not Great
customer_reviews.text: Really good but not Great Cordless Brad Nail gun. it out performs DeWalt , Makita, etc... This is the nail gun to go if you are a woodworker and want to go cordless. it is a bit on the heavy side but manageable, duration: out performs the competition, repeatability; Excellent. No jamming yet. submerges those nails every time. All of my tools are DeWalt brand but when it came to buying a nailer this was a much better buy. Sorry DeWalt but truth be told. Like i said it's a good nail gun, better then the competition, but still far from great.
customer_reviews.author: rudy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about buying a cordless nail gun but am so glad I did. No more lugging a compressor around the house and no more getting tangled in the hose. I’ve used this for trim, 2x4s, and 2x6s alike; it pounded brad nails through all of them with ease. The adjustment knobs are great for dialing in the nail depth. Very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a builder for over 40 years and have an impressive collection of pneumatic nail guns and I'm a big fan of this battery operated one. I used every size from 5/8" to 2" and it worked flawlessly. I chose the Ryobe brand because I have several other tools and that made it easy with all the tools taking the same type of battery. I am hoping that there will be more gun options available soon and I swear I will by them all. This gun is very versatile and will get used a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Iggyroo2000

customer_reviews.title: Flat Out Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item twice and neither one worked properly. The first one was a refurb and the second one was brand new. The first one flashed its lights indicating a malfunction. The second one shot a couple nails here and there, but most often it would just make a noise and not shoot a nail. This product is not ready for prime time. I did buy the 23 ga pin nailer and it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marc A. Gottfried

customer_reviews.title: Preforming better than I expected and my wife likes it also
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a “God send”... for either temporary holds until my glue can set up, or for my wife’s “light work” holds, this thing preforms well above what I bought it for. Rarely do I ever have to go back and finish sinking a Brad. I probably shouldn’t say this for fear that I will cause myself problems but, risking all, I have yet to have a Brad jam up. Spits out the brads perfectly every time
customer_reviews.author: Micheal Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Really good nail gun
customer_reviews.text: This nail gun is really good. I have several 18 volt tools that use the one+ battery system. I have yet to buy one that I didn't like. This nail gun is excellent like all the tools I have. I recommend it. It works really well and has a long run time especially on the 4 amphour batteries. It has a unique operating system in that it pumps up air pressure to power the nail strike mechanism. It is very adjustable for strike force and is consistent once set. Repeatability is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle shopper

customer_reviews.title: K-Tech Support Makes This a #5 Rating
customer_reviews.text: The tool actually does what is advertised to do but the Seller (K-Tech Enterprises) is the reason I gave this a 5 rating. After tool worked for a couple of months it developed an intermittent issue where it stopped functioning. Tried contacting Ryobi but no success. Voice message said to take to local repair center that was closed. Decided to contact K-Tech who responded within minutes and provided exchange with new replacement. I returned defective and received replacement just now. Thank you K-Tech for your fast and courteous response. I will look for your products in future. % star service company!!!
customer_reviews.author: William Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect for putting up walls and putting down flooring.
customer_reviews.text: It has some misfeeds on garbage nails from China, but that's my fault. Out of roughly 2000 brads, 2 didn't penetrate quite far enough and 1 jammed due to hitting metal. I'd say ll were pilot error. To my surprise, I could do entire rooms on a single charge. They sell 3 difference capacity batteries and I was using the smallest. If my air-powered framing nailer ever goes, I'll try one of these electrics for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Zun Guri

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT PRODUCT - WISH I PURCHASED IT A LONG TIME AGO.
customer_reviews.text: I can't really say how wonderful this product continues to be (for me) - I have 'nail/brad guns' in the garage but I have to take out my 'air compressor' to use them, this one is so easy to use it's amazing just to have it handy for various job projects. In may opinion, the price is as great as the product remains to be - if I ever need another one, I would definitely buy this again and recommend it to those who need serious brad nailing jobs done in a professional manner.
customer_reviews.author: DAG

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool and I highly recommend it. Whether you're a casual DIY'r or a fine furniture maker, this is a quality tool. It has a place in any workshop. I've never had a problem with jamming and I've put it to the test since I've owned it. 10 out of 10.
customer_reviews.author: Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for minor finishing. The gauge is small so it is only for finishing projects so don't buy it if you are trying to assemble something that needs structural support. Ryobi does a good job of standing behind their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ready to go
customer_reviews.text: Have not had it long enough for 5 star, but all you do is unpack, snap in battery and you are ready to go. No starting compressor or uncoiling air hose required. Very handy when you need Nailer in middle of project or quick repair around house. If you forgot to charge battery, just swap with your other Ryobi tools. Note that third party batteries are available for these tools that I have used successfully for couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice not needing a compressor
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tool to have, though it is a little expensive and rarely goes on sale (or is included in any combo kit). Once it is set up for proper depth there is nothing left to do but use it even when changing brad nail lengths. It is a little bulky, but light for it's size. The only real con is that (at least with my larger 4ah batteries) is that it doesn't rest firmly right side up, and tends to want to fall forward. Maybe shorter batteries don't have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use, like-new condition for refurb
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a refurbished model and was surprised by it's new condition, given the price. I'm amazed by how easy it is just to get this out and put away without any setup. Some people have talked about a delay in shooting the nails. I'm sure there is a brief delay, but it's VERY brief compared to traditional nail guns. I would recommend this to any homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: MCT

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works well. Used it on 3/4" pine and 1/2" hard maple with no problems. I do wish manufacturers would figure out how to make these nailers more compact and lighter.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: Love this to a, it's lightweight enough for me to be able to use several times on a job comma but it is heavy duty enough to get the job done. I really like that you can adjust How deep the nails get set.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Another great Ryobi tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this nail gun! I’ve been a shelf building fool! It’s so easy to use!!! My husband bought me for Christmas and probably one of my favorite gifts ever!
customer_reviews.author: Carol M

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: Was tired of dragging my compressor around for those small jobs so I bought this tool. Only complaint is it will not fire sometime when I first start using it. A slight adjustment gets it going OK after that. As battery goes down it seems like it cannot set the nail all the way. Knowing this I make sure I have a fully charged battery when I start a project.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Miracle
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic invention, this. The ability to DIY nail without a compressor? Earth changing. It is a bit heavy, and the rapid fire is not so rapid but none of that matters to me. This nailer ranks way up there. AND it uses the same battery as my weed eater!
customer_reviews.author: BoomerZoomer

customer_reviews.title: No Hassle
customer_reviews.text: Get rid of that compressor and hose and hassle. this product works great. It is adjustable for depth and power. Battery life is not an issue. I do have a backup up but in comparison to rolling out a compressor and 25 foot hose, this thing is easy and portable to the max. Love it!.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Knox

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted one, but didn’t like having to use a compressor to use it. All the cables and hoses always get caught on something you don’t want them too. Battery powered is the way to go. Get one or two extra batteries and you can go all day.
customer_reviews.author: philip

customer_reviews.title: Battery was crap.
customer_reviews.text: My battery was crap, at first I thought it was just me... but the damn thing just won’t charge. I’ve barely used this thing because I’ve had to use other batteries I have but they die to quickly with it. Kind of disappointing, the battery is kind of a big deal when it comes to something like this.
customer_reviews.author: DTetz

customer_reviews.title: ryobi 18 gauge one plus brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: this product was purchased in a used condition. there was no owners manual and no protective tip in the box. this should have been stated in the items description on the web site but was not. A used item does not mean parts are missing unless described in the description. I won't buy from this store again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So much nicer than a pneumatic nailer. No hoses or air compressors to lug around at hook up. Just load some nails and a battery and you’re set. So far have only used this tool for door trim. Simple air pressure adjustments sink nails to the perfect depth...no need to countersink the nails. So far, I love it
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: The nailer worked well when I used 1.5" nails. This nailer, as with all my other Ryobi tools, works well using its battery. And they cost less than other brand name tools. I buy only Ryobi tools.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wev

customer_reviews.title: Solid built  pro results!
customer_reviews.text: .I received my package today, took it out loaded the magazine with the supplied package nails and I was already up and running. very precise and lightweight. I like the auto option where you can keep your flinger pressed and it can shoot multiple nails. I was hoping to like the Ryobi P320 Airstrike 18 Volt One+ , as I am using other Ryobi 18V tools, and I really love it for e solid built Ease of use and pro results. I do not know how one can complete a project without this amazing tool. I would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Gal Meiri

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectation! LOVE THIS NAIL GUN!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! Performed better than the compressor-powered one I rented at Home Depot a few weeks before purchasing this... with a LOT LESS hassle! One of the best power tool purchases I've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Bee

customer_reviews.title: battery operated brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: slower cycle time than air source nailer, does have misfires and needs 50 amp battery for sustained operation. good value for the handyman tool chest but not for the full time woodworker
customer_reviews.author: Carbon-Key

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: The nailer has worked great for the time I've had it. I've shot a couple hundred one inch brads with it and it fouled only once. It does get heavy if you're working above the shoulders. You definitely want to shoot a few practice rounds to get the depth and air adjustment just right. After that it is very consistent in how it drives.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C

customer_reviews.title: Adds a lot of freedom of movement
customer_reviews.text: This a handy little tool. I like not having to drag around a hose and a noisy air compressor. A little on the heavy side but worth it. I would buy another one if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Ryobi Airstrike P-320 / 18ga brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: Got the replacement nail gun and it works great! I’m so happy I bought it lightweight and pretty compact as nail guns go! I recommend this to anyone wish I’d bought one a bit sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey P. Dellar

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy nails.
customer_reviews.text: A great pin nailer. Drives a 1.5 inch pin. I have used it to repair wood items and build things. It really helps to assemble things as they are glued up or just stabilize pieces prior to putting in permanent screws.
customer_reviews.author: removeb4flight

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tool -- allows you to shoot trim nails of different lengths quickly and easily. I have several batteries (and suggest you do too!) so power is never an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Richard G.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful in a small cordless nailer
customer_reviews.text: They "nailed" it with this model. The batteries last forever. The power is perfect for small to large projects (2 inch depth on the nails). I have used this in fencing and touching up loose trim.
customer_reviews.author: USC

customer_reviews.title: My favorite power tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I could not justify the cost of a pressure air tool system to do small jobs around the house. This tool perform beautifully on wood trims and small shelving jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood Vienna

customer_reviews.title: Big things come in small packages
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I'm redoing all the baseboard in my house, but for several reasons I have to do it in phases. This nailer is exactly what I needed, portable and powerful enough for what I need. You can't beat the value either; where I'd otherwise have to spend upwards of $200 for a compressor, pneumatic nailer, hose, etc., I got this refurbished for $80. I already had the battery from my Ryobi power drill, which is a HUGE plus. This thing REALLY packs a punch too; obviously for more heavy-duty applications it wouldn't be appropriate, but it's the perfect balance in the areas I need it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Hall

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life(although that has more to do with the battery pack itself). I like the fine adjustment and its great for the DIY work I do around the house and for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had medium expectations to use to install my ship lap in my bathroom remodel and wainscoting. Far exceeded them. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Seatiger

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for small, quick jobs.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing. Used it on a job where I had maybe 20 brads to nail. This was so easy compared to a traditional air nailer. It does have a short pressure build up when you pull the trigger (maybe a second or so) and it's a bit on the heavy side, but the portability more than makes up for that.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN K

customer_reviews.title: Great for finish work
customer_reviews.text: We had some finish work home repairs that needed the tiniest nails I have ever seen. We purchased this nail gun to avoid hammer marks and speed up our projects. We love it!!
customer_reviews.author: strychnine

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Wow does this thing have power for being battery operated! I was having so much fun even my fence has spots I repaired. I originally bought this for some cosmetic stuff inside and furniture but it can do so much more.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: I've used this now on several DIY projects fastening door trim, base molding, crown, cove and shoe molding. It's saved me so much time and certainly eliminates the hammer marks from missing when trying to drive a finish nail the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Like it but nailer gets stuck out and I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Like it but nailer gets stuck out and I have to open everything up between nailing to push the little metal pin back into chamber
customer_reviews.author: Vr4

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I was so worried before I bought this. Now I sleep well knowing that I made the right choice by making this purchase. There's no going back to hammer and nails when it comes to trim work.
customer_reviews.author: G. Milo

customer_reviews.title: Convent, reliable and very useful
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it. I have used 1 inch brads up to 2 inch brads without problem.
customer_reviews.author: DRB

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: I was deciding whether or not to get it. Good thing that I did. Saves you a lot of time!!
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like that fact it didn’t come together battery & charger , it’s a little heavy but nice to the trigger , I wouldn’t do a roof , but I would do small projects
customer_reviews.author: Maintenance Mike

customer_reviews.title: The amount of time saved is worth its weight in gold.
customer_reviews.text: It has become one of my most used power tools. It is a matter of speed being able to move forward and continue working while the glue dries has become indispensable for time management. As far as the product it self it is powerful if used correctly. You get a misfire about a third of the time but that is conman with most nail or brad guns. I would buy it again and I am looking in to the nailer version.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: High quality. Professional results.
customer_reviews.text: It’s heavy but its a tool. Great quality. Did a great job. Love the ability to use a battery and not an air compressor. High quality, professional results.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L.

customer_reviews.title: but it does an awesome job applying trim
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any other nailer with which to compare its performance, but it does an awesome job applying trim. I bought a refurbished unit for a significant discount and it looked and performed like new.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun/great
customer_reviews.text: Active DIY er. Use this to do moulding. Most strikes will get past the material if you place it right. Not as powerful as nailguns with an air compressor but gets the job done. Very convenient tool
customer_reviews.author: Engin Bahce

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: My husband used it for window trim in our basement. It was great that he didn't have to drag the air compressor from the shop and down the stairs to finish this job. He wishes we'd had one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn A. Waudby

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. So convenient not having to drag out air hoses
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Cheap Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and works great. Not as fast to reset after firing compared to co-worker's DeWalt or Bostitch cordless but about the same as my Paslode.
customer_reviews.author: Keiko

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use and works very well. Looking forward to more projects with it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Keller

customer_reviews.title: Easier than an air nail gun and just as good
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and super easy to use. I was questioning either an air nail gun or battery but this was definitely the right choice.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: everything looks like a nail
customer_reviews.text: when you're a hammer, everything looks like a nail; but when you're a Ryobi nail gun your home improvement fever spikes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is legit, way easier than hooking up to an air system. I don’t know how I got by without it before
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product!!!  Works as listed!!!
customer_reviews.text: This works well and does exactly what I need it to do! I would purchase again!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Southard

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Way easier than carrying a hose around and compressor. Working on trim for a 1600 square foot house and the battery is still full after doing 85% it. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chvilicek

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. I am using it for general household repairs and small projects.
customer_reviews.author: DesertSandSquid

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I use this almost every day in my shop. I dont know what I'd do without it.
customer_reviews.author: riley arendasky

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of small projects and will never go through the hassle of trying to hammer in small brads and finish nails again. This brad gun really "kicks butt" and the battery lasts a long time. The only downside would be the weight. It is quite heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this item looks good
customer_reviews.text: but doesn't work well I've had this unit for 8 months and its not working correctly and i havnt used this pin nailer over one hour of continuous use
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: No air lines, no compressor. This is a take anywhere, professional tool. Adjustable depth. Handles any brad. Lighter than I had expected. Works with all One Plus 18v batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. B.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, the company had their own branding on the unit however, not a fan of that but the tool itself is great
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Used it and drove a couple of hundred brads.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered thanks.Used it and drove a couple of hundred brads. Then it started firing blanks every other shot. I haven't tried to oil it or solve the problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Goguen

customer_reviews.title: Ryobi Nailed It!
customer_reviews.text: This tool is awesome! One of the best designed tools I've bought ever. I have to but more brads!
customer_reviews.author: B. Debley

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: This tool works as expected and was well worth the reasonable price I paid. Like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is quite convenient ans easy to carry. No bulky compressor need
customer_reviews.text: So far it performs quite well however you must have additional battery to replace because it runs out after approximately 3/4 hour of continuous use. Quite convenient no cord hassle.
customer_reviews.author: joann

customer_reviews.title: Love it love it love it
customer_reviews.text: Completely in love with this product. Was able to build out my garage and put up walls in a single day! Over 2000 nails used. Super fast!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, once.
customer_reviews.text: Worked once. Second time it started smoking and had not worked since, the light just flashes.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Ryobi is quality!
customer_reviews.text: One of my Husbands most used tools. We are remodeling our home and it’s seeing it’s fair share of work. We love the Ryobi brand and this tool meets the high expectations we have for their tools.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna T

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool and great value for money
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a professional but I’m a keen home DIY-er. This has been the best addition to my toolkit in a long time. Easy to use, adjustable, robust tool. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Webb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Took it out of the box. Read a few minor instructuons and went to work.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Saves me so much time with small project as I do not have screw things together. Very easy to us.
customer_reviews.author: Tien D. Bui

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and love the fact that one battery fits all tools.
customer_reviews.text: A little heavier than my air nailer but is more portable.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY E WARNER

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: best nailer I have ever used! I was sceptical because it is battery operated but I am extremely impressed at how strong and efficient it is. Big plus is that I can use the same 18V batteries as my other Ryobi tools.
customer_reviews.author: ranger

customer_reviews.title: Heavy design but dies everything I need !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was a little lighter. Still, best tool but in ages!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ellington

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, he loves it. And it arrived fast.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money. I've done a few somewhat large jobs with it
customer_reviews.author: JE-Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Well made.
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy, but likely necessary. Initial adjustments for nail depth was a little tough to get just right, but once set, it worked perfectly. Very please with the product.
customer_reviews.author: jlv

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I built some pigeon feeding boxes with Ryobi Nailer. Good bye hammer & nails. Works great .
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have only installed about 140 linear feet of 4" trim with this so far, but it works fantastically. I would guess I have shot about 300 nails through this and I have not had a single jam.
customer_reviews.author: Matt McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the nail gun. Purchased the item refurbished, looks and functions like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Product was in new condition, just a damaged box. It works as well as my air powered finish nail guns.
customer_reviews.author: cookiefoot

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the tool, very impressed at how much it could do with the 18v battery. Managed to re-install all the trim in my house very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: John Lothringer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & value
customer_reviews.text: Bought it "used like new" and it really is. Doesn't even look like it's been used. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: S Pottberg

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: A little heavvy, but does a great job. a 6 Mah battery keeps it running all day.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

product_meta.title: Ryobi P320 Airstrike 18 Volt One+ Lithium Ion Cordless Brad Nailer (Battery Not Included, Power Tool Only)
product_meta.description: The Ryobi P320 brad nailer has comparable power to some gas-powered nailers and the convenience of a cordless power tool. Any nailing job you may need to perform around the house, from installing roofing tiles to reinforcing joints, can be accomplished with the P320. On a single charge of a 4 amp hour battery from Ryobi’s One+ system, you can fire up to 700 nails up to 50 millimeters long. Adjust your depth with an onboard dial so you do not have to worry about fiddling with extra tools. Be sure to see what you are working on with the built-in LED lighting, and keep it handy with the attached belt clip. Get what you need to get done with the P320. It’s built for work, so get to it.
feature_bullets: Drives up to 1700 nails per charge
No compressors, hoses or pricey gas cartridges required. Cordless design offers both convenience and superior performance.
Convenient adjustment dial regulates air pressure for optimum results.
Low-nail indicator to quickly and easily see when it is time to reload
Includes: 18-V ONE AirStrike 18-Gauge Cordless Brad Nailer, Battery sold separately

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars606 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
